channel.title: What libraries exactly are needed? (scala?)
channel.description:
I'm writing up a script to archive up the exact minimum needed to run this server, and, as-is, it was 40+mb. After excluding all of the javadoc and source jars, it was 20+, I can get it down to 4ish (which is decent) if I exclude the scala compiler and library, is the compiler needed to run the program? Is the library? Are there any other libraries that aren't used?
Beta will be very soon if I can get these questions answered. Thanks.

item.title: What libraries exactly are needed? (scala?)
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:11, topic:436242”]Ant takes care of things like not re-building when it is already built and such, so if it is built you are just running checks to be sure that only take a second, if that.[/quote]But it depends on resolve, which takes quite a bit more than a second. In total, you add about 10 seconds to run, and while developing it’s annoying as hell. Especially when the startup process of the server itself takes so long.

Read full topic

Ant takes care of things like not re-building when it is already built and such, so if it is built you are just running checks to be sure that only take a second, if that.

item.title: What libraries exactly are needed? (scala?)
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:436242”]Ok, new pre-beta branch auto-build set up here:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/MoparClassic_Beta/

I’ve also made some much-needed changes to the horrible mess of ant build scripts that didn’t work (run needs to depend on build, gameserver failed at everything until lib_managed was manually created, then the first jar build failed because no jars were in the path until AFTER ivy ran), removed moparclassic.jar which shouldn’t have been in the repo, and changed the shell scripts not to rely on ant (‘ant run’ is certainly as easy to script or type as a shell script).

Also updated the database.sql file quite a bit, refer to github for the changes.

Getting rather close to an open beta I think, maybe tomorrow if the clean-shutdown issue can be fixed…[/quote]
Why would you want to build every time you run it? This seems silly.

Read full topic

item.title: What libraries exactly are needed? (scala?)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Ok, new pre-beta branch auto-build set up here:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/MoparClassic_Beta/

I’ve also made some much-needed changes to the horrible mess of ant build scripts that didn’t work (run needs to depend on build, gameserver failed at everything until lib_managed was manually created, then the first jar build failed because no jars were in the path until AFTER ivy ran), removed moparclassic.jar which shouldn’t have been in the repo, and changed the shell scripts not to rely on ant (‘ant run’ is certainly as easy to script or type as a shell script).

Also updated the database.sql file quite a bit, refer to github for the changes.

Getting rather close to an open beta I think, maybe tomorrow if the clean-shutdown issue can be fixed…

Read full topic

item.title: What libraries exactly are needed? (scala?)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It does not run when scala-library isn’t included, it does finish booting with only this classpath though:

lib/mina.jar:lib_managed/commons-collections-3.2.1.jar:lib_managed/jansi-1.4.jar:lib_managed/jcip-annotations-1.0.jar:lib_managed/mysql-connector-java-5.1.18.jar:lib_managed/scala-library-2.9.1.jar:lib_managed/jline-2.9.1.jar:lib_managed/mail-1.4.4.jar:lib_managed/activation-1.1.jar:lib_managed/slf4j-api-1.6.3.jar:lib_managed/bsh-2.0b4.jar:lib_managed/slf4j-simple-1.6.3.jar:module/DataStoreCore.jar:module/XMLUsingXStreamDataStore.jar

Anyone know if any of those can be omitted though?

Read full topic

item.title: What libraries exactly are needed? (scala?)
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I can read that, but that doesn’t mean that it is actually required. Like I don’t think the scala-compiler is needed just for running it.

Yeah well, I think that’s the only lib that’s only required for compiling.

Read full topic

item.title: What libraries exactly are needed? (scala?)
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

<dependencies>
<dependency org="org.scala-lang" name="scala-library" rev="2.9.1" />

<dependency org="org.scala-lang" name="scala-compiler" rev="2.9.1" />

<dependency org="javax.mail" name="mail" rev="1.4.4" />

<dependency org="mysql" name="mysql-connector-java" rev="5.1.18" />

<dependency org="org.beanshell" name="bsh" rev="2.0b4"/>

<dependency org="commons-collections" name="commons-collections" rev="3.2.1"/>

<dependency org="org.slf4j" name="slf4j-simple" rev="1.6.3"/>

<dependency org="net.jcip" name="jcip-annotations" rev="1.0"/>

</dependencies>

Read full topic
